entry.def: A phobic feeling or reaction results from or is related to a strong, irrational fear or hatred of something.

example.ex: Many children acquire a phobic horror of dogs.

entry.def: Someone who is phobic has a strong, irrational fear or hatred of something.

example.ex: In Victorian times people were phobic about getting on trains. They weren't used to it.
example.tran: 在维多利亚时代，人们对坐火车怕得要命。他们对此还不习惯。

auth_sentence.content: He was phobic about fruit and wouldn't touch it.
auth_sentence.res_content: He was phobic about fruit and wouldn't touch it.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He was phobic about fruit and wouldn't touch it.

auth_sentence.content: Second, phobic avoidance of a feared situation will only increase with time.
auth_sentence.res_content: Second, phobic avoidance of a feared situation will only increase with time.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Second, phobic avoidance of a feared situation will only increase with time.

auth_sentence.content: Nicholas White wasn't phobic, but he wasn't exactly fond of elevators.
